moves.2. d4 d5 3. e5: ? I play the Advance Variation in the French Defense! Maybe not the best move, according to Gameknots own Database. Better was Nc3 or Nd2!
moves.3... c5: A very common pawn-push in this and similar positions. Black tries to attack the base in Whites pawn chain, here the pawn at d4!
moves.4. c3: My standard response to c5. All other alternatives I´m seeing as weaker, with the risk of getting a weak pawn and all such drawbacks!
moves.4... cxd4: A very weak move according to the Gameknot Database! Giving me a somewhat easier play. Better was Nc6 or Qb6!
moves.6. Nf3: At this point, I had a pretty good game, maybe even some slight advantage?
moves.6... Qb6 7. Be2 Bb4+ 8. Nc3 Nge7 9. a3: ? Maybe was it better to continue development with Bd2 or even 0-0 ?
moves.11... Bd7 12. Bd2: Continuous development. Now is it time to come up with some kind of plan for the middlegame!
moves.12... h6 13. Rb1: Chasing the queen away! It´s also seen as good strategy to centralize the rooks in the beginning of the middlegame!
moves.13... Qc7 14. Bd3: Aiming towards the kingside with my light-squared bishop.
moves.14... g6: ? Maybe not the best if Black plans to castle kingside? But maybe has Black other plans?
moves.15. Bb5 O-O-O: Castling queenside was maybe Blacks best option here, because he had weakened his pawn shield on the kingside. It´s also possible that Black plans a pawn storm on the kingside!
moves.16. Bxc6 Bxc6 17. Rc1 b5: It don´t look like Black want to make a pawn storm on my kingside after all?
moves.18. Rb1 a6: Now is Blacks pawn shield in front of the King to some extent weakened! Not very good!
moves.19. Qc1 g5 20. Re1 Rdg8 21. g4: I have heard a theoretical wisdom that if the center is locked, you can advance with your pawns in front of your King, without too much risk!
moves.23... h5 24. f3: Now have I defended my Kings camp successfully, at least for the moment!
moves.24... f5: Black tries to increase the pressure!
moves.25... f4: A little miss there? The pawn is actually undefended !
moves.26. Bxf4: My bishop swallows the pawn with good appetite!
moves.28. Kh2 Rgf8: Threatens my bishop and also increases the pressure on the f-file !
moves.30... Be8 31. Qd2: I made a proposal to change queens! Think that I have some advantage now, a defended free pawn and all that, so it made a point to try to reach an endgame here!
moves.34... Be4 35. Qf2: The game has changed to some kind of slow manouvering with the goal to step by step slowly placing the pieces better! I think that´s named positional play?
moves.35... Rf5 36. Rxe4: A positional sacrifice! I wasn´t clear if this would winning, but it felt right !
moves.36... dxe4 37. Qe3 Rf7 38. Re1: And Black can´t defend his e 4-pawn !
moves.38... Rhf8: Black are trying to make counter-threats! In this case against my f 4- pawn!
moves.39. Rf1: Must defend it with my Rook !
moves.39... Kd7 40. Kg2: I tried to reorganize a bit!
moves.42. Bh2 Kd5: Don´t think that this King walk to the center is good for my opponent ? Seems too risky in my opinion.
moves.45. Re1: The e4 -pawn will fall with havoc in Blacks camp !
moves.45... Qxc3: Wins  a pawn, but definitely not the game!
moves.48... Qe3 49. Bxe3#: Checkmate. A Happy ending for me in this game! I was especially proud to win against a player with over 1600 in rating!
